intro: Euplassa goyazensis, commonly known as the Goyazensis euplassa, is a rare flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
